definition: secondary/auxiliary/deputy/assistant/vice-/abbr. for 副詞|副词 adverb/classifier for pairs, sets of things & facial expressions
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: For many, driving a taxi is merely a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 对大多数美国人而言，开计程车只是一种副业。

sentences.english: Why not start a side business doing pet-sitting or training?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不开办一个宠物照料或训练的副业？

sentences.english: You can’t be a leader from the sideline.
sentences.chinese: 你不能成为副业中的领导者。

sentences.english: It is a fine tradition for our national army that engages agricultural sideline production.
sentences.chinese: 部队从事农副业生产是我军的光荣传统。

sentences.english: Building a side business is one of the best ways to invest in your future.
sentences.chinese: 搭建一个副业是投资于未来的最好方法之一。

sentences.english: We raise ducks as a sideline.
Raising pigs is the best household sideline and a good way of making money for farmers.
sentences.chinese: 养猪是最好的家庭副业，是农民致富的好帮手。

sentences.english: Dance, then, is a great avocation for you.
sentences.chinese: 那么跳舞对你来说就是一个“副业”。

sentences.english: The people in the village become rich by doing part-time work, so every family builds its new building of two stages.
sentences.chinese: 村里的人搞副业发了家，户户都盖起了两层楼的新房。

sentences.english: Bookkeeping is Mr. Jones' vocation, and photography is his avocation.
sentences.chinese: 薄记是琼斯先生的职业，照相他的副业。

sentences.english: To increase income, they needed to feed pigs and grow vegetables as a sideline.
sentences.chinese: 增加收入，他们需要喂猪和种植蔬菜作为副业。

sentences.english: He said it is just a part-time job and his main online store is a flower delivery service.
sentences.chinese: 他说这只是副业，他的店主要提供鲜花快递服务。

sentences.english: Raising white wax insects is very profitable in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 放养白蜡虫是农村非常有利的副业。

sentences.english: He is a doctor by profession and a novelist by avocation.
sentences.chinese: 他的职业是医生，副业是作家。

definition: business in which a company has traditionally engaged (e.g. before diversifying)/original business/core business/(literary) agriculture
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
